intro: Prasium medium, commonly known as the common marsh orchid, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh habitats. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features erect, leafless stems with whorled, lance-shaped leaves and produces spikes of pale yellow to greenish-white flowers. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in waterlogged soils. Prasium medium plays an important ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining wetland biodiversity.
